ai.summary: The Craignamaddy Circuit is a challenging 32.3 km circular hike in the UK. As a hard route, it traverses varied, exposed terrain over a full day of walking, with multiple ascents and long stretches of moorland and rocky ground. Expect remote sections, changing weather, and a need for solid navigation and fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: A long-distance circuit with mixed terrain: open moorland, rocky footing, potential boggy sections, and uneven gradients. The route includes exposed stretches where weather can impact visibility and footing; plan for a full day of walking with minimal shelter in places.
ai.safety_notes: Carry a current map and compass (or a GPS device) and know how to navigate. Check weather forecasts and be prepared for sudden changes. Start early to maximize daylight and keep a steady pace to avoid exhaustion. Tell someone your planned route and timings. Stay hydrated, bring sufficient food, and carry a waterproof layer and warm clothing. In remote areas, be aware of navigation hazards, sudden bog, loose rocks, and exposure; carry a whistle and a basic first-aid kit.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) generally offers the best conditions and daylight. Summer provides long days, but weather can still be variable; winter hiking on this route is best avoided by those without alpine hiking experience.

seo.title: Craignamaddy Circuit Hiking Guide | 32.3 km Hard Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your Craignamaddy Circuit hike in the UK. A 32.3 km hard circuit featuring mixed terrain, exposure, and rugged moorland. Safety tips, gear list, and best seasons included.
